step1_initial_points.title: Navigating the Complex AI Market
step1_initial_points.description: The department lacks a clear understanding of the current AI solutions relevant to government functions and needs to build a 'catalogue of offerings' to inform future procurement and project planning.

step1_initial_points.title: Ensuring Strict Regulatory Compliance
step1_initial_points.description: There is significant concern about adopting AI tools that may not comply with mandatory government ICT, Security, Cyber, and Information Privacy Principles (IPPs), creating a major adoption risk.

step1_initial_points.title: Safeguarding Sensitive Government Data
step1_initial_points.description: Protecting the security and integrity of government data is paramount, especially when considering AI solutions that integrate with third-party offerings like Large Language Models (LLMs).

step1_initial_points.title: Integrating AI with Existing IT Systems
step1_initial_points.description: The buyer is uncertain about the maturity, scalability, and adaptability of vendor solutions for successful integration into existing, complex government IT systems and platforms.

step1_initial_points.title: Budgetary Uncertainty for AI Investment
step1_initial_points.description: The department cannot effectively plan budgets or allocate funds for future AI procurement without first obtaining indicative costing models and pricing structures from the market.

step1_initial_points.title: Lack of Proven Public Sector Use Cases
step1_initial_points.description: DPC is risk-averse and requires evidence of reliable performance and successful AI deployments in similar government contexts to validate solutions and justify investment.

step1_initial_points.title: Anticipated Internal Skills Gap & Training Need
step1_initial_points.description: There is a concern about the internal resources, staff capabilities, and training required to successfully deploy, operate, and support new AI tools across government agencies.

step1_initial_points.title: Fear of Technology Obsolescence
step1_initial_points.description: In the rapidly changing AI landscape, the buyer is concerned about investing in a solution that may become outdated, seeking vendors with clear plans for future enhancements.
